title: Gotham: Complementary font ideas?
content:
Hi All,

This is my first post, please bear with me.

We are using Gotham and I'd like some ideas about which font would be nicely paired with it.

- For copy text, should we use Gotham just for headlines and then a serif for the body text?

- If so, what would you recommend that would look tasteful with Gotham.

I am always humbled by the wealth of knowledge in these forums - thank you in advance.

Sean
author: seanwood

comments.content: I saw the image and thought "Jenson". Maybe it's just wild guess. Beautiful typeface, Gotham.

sorry if you've already looked in the obvious place, but H&FJ actually  
make some of their own recommendations:

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100008](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214062939/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100008 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100008")

(bottom of the page)

H&FJ just wants you to buy more of their fonts. Gotham goes well with a lot. It's great as the strapline on a lot of logos. But I don't have any particular recommendations for pairings. If you find a font you like, we can tell you whether we think it goes well with Gotham, though.
The Obama campaign is certainly using Gotham with Requiem pretty effectively.
